procedure.title: Adding eventlog sources
procedure.para: To forward the messages from an eventlog container to your central log server, complete the following steps.
You need to know the name of the eventlog container. If you do not know the name of the container, see or .

step.para: Start the configuration interface of the &agent; application.
Select syslog-ng Agent Settings > Eventlog Sources, and double-click on Event Containers.

Click Add, and enter the name of the container into the Event Container Name field. You can use the * and ? wildcard characters in the name of the container. That way you can handle multiple eventlog containers in a single source.
If you use wildcards in the name of the eventlog container, note the following points:

listitem.para: If none of the existing eventlog containers match the pattern, the &agentabbrev; will send a warning message into the debug log. For details on enabling debug logs, see .

The &agentabbrev; application checks for new eventlog containers only when it starts or restarts. If a new eventlog container is created with a name that matches the pattern of an eventlog source, restart the &agentabbrev; service.

warning.para: Hazard of data loss! If you use wildcards in multiple eventlog source names, make sure that only one pattern matches every container name. If two eventlog sources match the same container, &agentabbrev; might ignore the messages of the eventlog container.

step.para: Click Apply, then OK. To activate the changes, restart the &agentabbrev; service.

The &agentabbrev; application starts sending new messages from the newly added eventlog container. Note that the &agentabbrev; will send existing messages from the eventlog container only if you have selected the Read Old Records option.
